qas.question: When was OPEC production of oil being surpassed?
Which year did the price of oil drop to $10 per barrel?
Why did Saudi Arabia try to increase production, and reduce profits for high cost producers?
In 1979, during the oil crisis, what was the highest price of oil?
In what year was other countries oil production surpassed by Saudi Arabia?
What did OPEC do to gain market share in 1979?
What were two consequences of OPEC pushing down oil prices in 1981?
What did the world price of oil peak at in 1973?
What did the price of oil fall to during the 1979 oil crisis?

context: OPEC soon lost its preeminent position, and in <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><a0_4><b4_0>1981<b4_0/><a0_4/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, its production was surpassed by that of other countries. Additionally, its own member nations were divided. Saudi Arabia, <a2_1>trying <a2_3>to <a2_0><a2_2><a2_4>recover market share<a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>, <b5_0>increased production<b5_0/>, pushing prices down, <b6_0>shrinking or eliminating profits<b6_0/> for high-cost producers. The world price, which had peaked during the 1979 energy crisis at <a3_0><a3_1><b7_0>nearly <a3_2><a3_3><a3_4>$40 per barrel<b7_0/><a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, decreased <a1_1>during the <a1_0><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4>1980s<a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> to <b8_0>less than $10 per barrel<b8_0/>. Adjusted for inflation, oil briefly fell back to pre-1973 levels. This "sale" price was a windfall for oil-importing nations, both developing and developed.
